downloadReport.title: Download report
downloadReport.knownIssuesDescription: A part of the GBIF processing is to flag occurrences that have suspicious fields

downloadReport.cancel: Go back and add more filters
downloadReport.proceed: Proceed – I can use a suitable tool
downloadReport.requestingFullDownload: You are requesting a full download of all occurrence data in GBIF.

downloadReport.onceDownloaded: Once you have downloaded the file, you will need approximately {SIZE_FORMATTED} of free disk space to unzip the data.
downloadReport.youWillNotBeAble: You will not be able to view or analyse the data in Excel or similar applications. To work with these data, you will need knowledge of a tool like R, Python or relational databases.
downloadReport.difficultToAnalyse: You will not be able to view or analyse the data in Excel or similar applications. A dataset of this size is difficult to analyse on an ordinary computer. You will probably need access to a distributed computing service or 'Big Data' tools.

SIMPLE_CSV.title: Occurrence list
SIMPLE_CSV.description: A single CSV file with standardized, interpreted occurrence data.

DWCA.title: Darwin Core Archive
DWCA.description: Multiple files (core, raw values, interpreted data, extensions) for detailed or specialized use. The download can be customized by selecting specific extensions.

SPECIES_LIST.title: Species list
SPECIES_LIST.description: A distinct list of species with occurrence counts.

SQL_CUBE.title: Occurrence cube
SQL_CUBE.description: Gridded occurrence counts by taxonomic, spatial and temporal dimensions. Dimensions and aggregations can be configured in the next step.

SQL_TSV_ZIP.title: SQL
SQL_TSV_ZIP.description: Custom SQL query to extract specific data or aggregations. Suitable for advanced users familiar with SQL.

taxonomySelector.title: Taxonomic Reference
taxonomySelector.description: Select the taxonomy that will be used to populate the taxonomic columns in the download
taxonomySelector.defaultRecommended: Default and recommended for most users

customSqlDownload.title: Create new SQL download
customSqlDownload.notification: The easiest way to download and explore data is via the occurrence search user interface. But for complex queries and aggregations, then the SQL editor provides more freedom.
customSqlDownload.cubeDescription: Configure spatial, temporal, and taxonomic resolution.
customSqlDownload.sqlMachineDescriptionIntro: The SQL download was generated based on user provided parameters
customSqlDownload.countHigherTaxonomy: Occurrence count at higher taxonomic level
customSqlDownload.errorMinimumDimension: At least one dimension must be selected
customSqlDownload.errorMinimumDimensionForCube: At least one dimension must be selected for cube data
customSqlDownload.removeRecordsTaxonIssues: Remove records that could not be confidently matched to a taxon
customSqlDownload.removeFossilsAndLiving: Remove records of fossils and living specimens, e.g. at botanical and zoological gardens

help.whatIsThis:
This download format allows you to aggregate occurrences by their taxonomic, temporal and/or spatial properties. For example, a data cube can be configured to aggregate occurrences by family, month and grid cell of the European Environment Agency reference grid (three dimensions) and count the number of occurrences (a measure) per combination. The result is a CSV file.

Once configured, a SQL query will be created to generate the data cube. For more advanced use, it is possible to further customize the query by editing the created SQL.
help.dimensions: A dimension represents an aspect along which data can be aggregated. Selecting a higher resolution (e.g. species over family, date over year, 100 m over 10 km) will result in more categories and therefore more records.
help.taxonomicDimension: This dimension aggregates occurrences by their taxonomic rank.
help.temporalDimension: This dimension aggregates occurrences by time.
help.dataQuality: Additional quality filters to apply to the data.
help.grid: This dimension aggregates occurrences in a spatial grid.
help.gridResolution: The size of each grid cell.
help.randomizePoints: For occurrence records with a coordinate uncertainty that covers more than one grid cell, should a random cell be chosen? If no is chosen, then the cell containing the centroid of the record is used.
help.measurements: A calculated quantitative value for each combination of dimensions.
help.higherTaxonomy: Additional higher taxonomic ranks for which the number of occurrences should also be included. Useful to assert sampling bias.
help.minCoordinateUncertainty: The lowest recorded coordinate uncertainty (in meters). Useful to assert the spatial precision of the data.
help.minTemporalUncertainty: The lowest recorded temporal uncertainty (in seconds). Useful to assert the temporal precision of the data.
help.editSql: The easiest way to download and explore data is via the occurrence search user interface. But for complex queries and aggregations, the SQL editor provides more freedom.
